message.content:
cs.DC, cs.DS, cs.IT, cs.LG, cs.NE

Reasoning: The paper deals with the fundamental question of what can be computed in a distributed fashion, which is a core topic in distributed systems and networking research. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.DC (Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing). The paper also involves optimization problems and algorithms, which are common topics in cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms) and cs.LG (Machine Learning). The use of linear programming suggests a possible fit with cs.IT (Information Theory). Finally, the study of local computation and approximation in networks may also fall under cs.NE (Networks and Internet Architecture).
